text: Movement For! () is a liberal political party in Latvia. The party was founded on 26 August 2017 at the House of Culture Rītausma in Riga with 298 party members.Reģistrējoties teju 300 biedriem nodibina partiju Kustība Par!. tvnet.lv. Accessed on 27 February 2018. The party is one of the members of the Development/For! alliance. ==History== Movement For! did not participate in Latvian parliamentary election in 2014, but received representation in the Saeima when Lolita Čigāne, Ints Dālderis, Andrejs Judins and Aleksejs Loskutovs defected from Unity in July 2017, with Čigāne suggesting the Latvian political spectrum needed a centrist, pro-European party. In February 2018, Saeima members Judins and Loskutovs left the "Movement For". Dālderis and Čigāne retired from the party in April 2018, depriving it of its remaining members of parliament. In June 2018, member of European Parliament Artis Pabriks (former foreign minister and minister of defense of Latvia) defected from Unity to the Movement For, thereby representing the new party in the European Parliament. He continues to sit with the centre-right European People's Party group. Pabriks has also announced to run for the 2018 parliamentary election on the joint list of Latvian Development and Movement For. He was the prime ministerial candidate of Development/For! in the 2018 parliamentary election. ===Latvian parliamentary election, 2018=== In March 2018, Movement For! formed the Development/For! electoral alliance with two small liberal and pro-European parties, Latvian Development (Latvijas attīstībai) and Growth (Izaugsme), to run in the Latvian parliamentary election in October of the same year together. The alliance was fully registered on 20 April 2018. The alliance came in 4th in the election and joined the Kariņš cabinet. The party was accepted as a full member of the Alliance of Liberals and Democrats for Europe in October 2019.https://www.aldeparty.eu/news/alde-welcomes-new-member-parties-1 ==Organisation== ===Leadership=== The party's leader from 2017 till now is Daniels Pavļuts, currently MP in Saeima and leader of the Development/For! fraction and former Minister of Economics in the Third Dombrovskis cabinet.dombrovskis-3.pdf | Government of Latvia. mk.gov.lv. Accessed on 27 February 2018. From 2017 to 2019 there were a 8 board members: former politician Ilze Viņķele, MP of the Saeima Ints Dālderis, political analyst Marija Golubeva, corporate lawyer Evita Goša, economist Kaspars Briškens, Ventspils State Gymnasium No.1 deputy director Oskars Kaulēns, entrepreneur Mārtiņš Staķis and Ministry of Transport official Andulis Židkovs.Partiju Kustība Par! vadīs Pavļuts, valdē ievēlē arī Viņķeli un Dālderi. Latvijas Sabiedriskais medijs. Accessed on 27 February 2018. In June of 2019 new, bigger board with 11 members was elected: minister of health Ilze Viņķele, MP of the Saeima Marija Golubeva, MP of the Saeima Mārtiņš Staķis, MP of the Saeima Vita Anda Tērauda, MP of the Saeima Dace Bluķe, MP of the Saeima Mārtiņš Staķis, senior consultant of the Development/For! fraction in Saeima Vladislava Šķēle, entrepreneur Normunds Mihailovs, DevOp Edgars Jēkabsons and entrepreneur Jevgenijs Lurje. ==Policies== ===Party manifesto=== The party's manifesto emphasizes the need for a unity of society, accessible public health care for everyone, rule of law standing over power and fair trial standing over corruption. The manifesto also calls for a reorganization of the powers to counties and cities, state aid for globally sustainable businesses, and addressing the issue of non-citizens in Latvia. Regarding public safety and foreign policy Movement For! seeks for a close cooperation between Latvia and European Union as well as NATO.Manifests | Movement For!. kustibapar.lv.
